p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:14pt; color:#00aa00;

p.span: The principle by which the movement of objects is as follows: each body has characteristics such as the position of the body in x and y and the speed of the body in x and y. At each time the coordinates of the body is added to the appropriate projection of the speed, if the body acts force, the nature of the movement will be uneven. The acceleration of the body is carried out by the Second Newton's law. The force calculated in advance is multiplied by sin or cos to calculate the projections of forces by x and y, and then it is divided by body weight. The obtained values are added to the velocity projections, the resulting velocities are added to the positions of the bodies in x and y.

p.span: Fn - force acting on the body from the n side of the body

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: ax is the projection of the acceleration on x
ay is the projection of the acceleration on the y

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: vx - the projection of the speed x
vy is the projection of the speed on y

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:12pt; color:#000000;

p.span: x - position of the body x
y - position of the body y

p.span: R(x1, y1, x2, y2) - distance between bodies 1 and 2

p.style: -qt-paragraph-type:empty; margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:0px; -qt-block-indent:0; text-indent:0px; font-size:10pt; color:#000000;

p.span: Fn = G * m * mn / R(x, y, xn, yn)^2
